revised_title: Comparative Anatomy of Mammalian Eye and Ophthalmoscopic Examination
tldr: The authors conducted a comprehensive study on the comparative anatomy of the mammalian eye, examining 181 different species. They observed the coloration of the Fundus oculi, the vascularization of the retina, and various eye structures such as the nictitating membrane and the retractor muscle of the eyeball. The study also discussed the differences in vision and eye adaptations among various mammalian orders.
